intro: Satureja rumelica, commonly known as mountain thyme, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of the Mediterranean. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–40 cm and produces small, tubular flowers in shades of pink or purple. Its leaves are aromatic, often used in traditional medicine for their antiseptic and anti-inflammatory properties. Satureja rumelica thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a hardy plant suitable for rock gardens and alpine settings.
